findings.title: Malicious libraries
findings.description: The audit report checks for malicious libraries in the smart contract codebase.

findings.title: Compiler version not fixed
findings.description: The compiler version used to compile the smart contract is not fixed, which can lead to potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Redundant fallback function
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Send instead of transfer
findings.description: The return value of an external transfer/transferFrom call is not checked.

findings.title: Style guide violation
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Unchecked external call
findings.description: The return value of an external transfer/transferFrom call is not checked.

findings.title: Unchecked Math
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Unsafe type inference
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Implicit visibility level
findings.description: The Visibility of state variables is not defined. Labeling the visibility explicitly makes it easier to catch incorrect assumptions about who can access the variable.

findings.title: Users will lose their token if calling a wrong “days” in relock_stake() function
findings.description: If users put any number of days to the relock_stake() function, it will turn their locked_amount to 0, resulting in loss of tokens.

findings.title: Users will lose their tokens if it’s transferred to another user
findings.description: Users will receive an equivalent amount of Bolly Stake token after staking their Bolly coins. Users can send their Bolly Stake tokens to other users on the network. Unfortunately, we've discovered that if users attempt or inadvertently transfer their Bolly Stake token to other users, their Bolly Stake token will be lost forever because the contract is not designed for transferring as described by the Auditee.

findings.title: Uncheck transfer
findings.description: The return value of an external transfer/transferFrom call is not checked.

findings.title: Comparison to boolean constants
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Conformance to Solidity naming conventions
findings.description: The Auditee should follow the Solidity naming convention.

findings.title: Unused variable
findings.description: The Auditee should remove the unused “mapping(address => locked) users;” at line 845 if it’s not used in the contract.

findings.title: State Variable Default Visibility
findings.description: The visibility of state variables users and users_stake is not defined, making it easier to catch incorrect assumptions about who can access the variable.

findings.title: Re-entrancy
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Timestamp Dependence
findings.description: The smart contract codebase was checked for Timestamp Dependence vulnerability.

findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Transaction-Ordering Dependence
findings.description: The smart contract codebase was checked for Transaction-Ordering Dependence vulnerability.

findings.title: Transfer forwards all gas
findings.description: The transfer function does not check the return value of an external transfer/transferFrom call.

findings.title: ERC20 API violation
findings.description: Violation of ERC-20 token standards implementation.
